title: CARE Act
text:
The Child Abuse Reform and Enforcement (CARE) Act is a <a href="United%20States">United States</a> <a href="law">law</a> aiming to "promote the improvement of information on, and protections against, <a href="child%20sexual%20abuse">child sexual abuse</a>".
Major provisions of the act.
The Child Abuse Reform and Enforcement Act was enacted on March 10, 2000, to reduce the incidence of child abuse and neglect.
Major Provisions of the Act
